Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Date Fields appear empty on first load when initialized with Vue" (#7251) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.5.11

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/u1wssnwL/3/](https://jsfiddle.net/u1wssnwL/3/)

### Steps to reproduce
Create an input with a type date and initialize with any valid date value. 

View on Safari IOS and you'll see that it will appear as empty although the value is set because when you click the field, you'll see that the IOS datepicker will be set to the value you provided.

It only affects date inputs that have been initialized with Vue and in the JSFiddle provided, there are 2 date inputs for easier reproduction

### What is expected?
Both date inputs should have the same value

### What is actually happening?
The date input that was initialized with Vue appears empty

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "can we have option for set document " (#7250) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Â∏åÊúõËÉΩÊúâÈÅ∏È†ÖÂèØ‰ª•ËÆìÊàëÂÄëËá™Ë®Ç Vue ÊâÄ‰ΩøÁî®ÁöÑ document ËÄå‰∏çÈúÄË¶ÅÂéªÂ∞á document Ë®≠ÂÆöÁÇ∫ global var
‰∏¶‰∏îÊîØÊè¥ËÆì document ÂèØ‰ª•Âú®Â∞éÂÖ• vue ‰πãÂæå ÊâçÂª∫Á´ã

hope can have option set document that vuejs use
so we didn't need set document to global if we didn't have
or can make us set document "** after import vue **"


### What does the proposed API look like?
`Vue.options.document = (a document like object we wanna use)`

`Vue.document = Vue.options.document || document;`

---

```
function createTextNode (text) {
  return document.createTextNode(text)
}
```

to

```
function createTextNode (text) {
  return Vue.document.createTextNode(text)
}
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[bug] Unable to use Custom Elements (Web Components) inside Vue components." (#7249) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody: ## Summary I have some custom elements registered, for example: ```js class DomNode { ... } customElements.define('i-dom-node', DomNode) ``` Then, if I try to use them in a Vue component like so: ```html ``` then I get an error like the following: ``` [Vue warn]: Unknown custom element: - did you register the component correctly? For recursive components, make sure to provide the "name" option. (found in ) ``` ## More info My Vue component's entire `

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Why not redirect automatically but add a extra param manually in the last redirec?" (#1942) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### What problem does this feature solve?
At , [#1938](https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/issues/1938) ,I said the router can't redirect to the page I want . and @posva  said I should add a param in the last redirect as well. I tried it , and succeed But I want to say , I  did assign the params "bigCata" in the last redirect , why not redirect automatically but add a extra param manually in the last redirec?

### What does the proposed API look like?
Automatically redirect to the page I want.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Cant redirect continuously when the path is dynamic" (#1938) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody: ### Version 3.0.1 ### Reproduction link [https://codepen.io/wangyi7099/pen/JMdRYq](https://codepen.io/wangyi7099/pen/JMdRYq) ### Steps to reproduce As I want to set the default render component when the parent component was rendered. so I use redirect to redirect to the component I want to render for the default. But it seems not to work, when I want to redirect component continuously when the path is dynamic.And the console shows the warning:" [vue-router] missing param for redirect route with path "/:bigCata/smallCata": Expected "bigCata" to be defined" ### What is expected? The default components can be rendered. When I click the `````` -> redirect to the path:"/index/bigCata/smallCata" ### What is actually happening? It doesn't redirect to the smallCata..

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Adding children and parent to currentRoute" (#1941) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
Also adding .vscode (IDE settings file) to .gitignore

@posva I'd like to have the feature #1650 was trying to add but it looks like there are too many unrelated changes in that PR and it hasn't been updated with your comments for a little while so I decided to try re-work it here. Thank you for your consideration.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "`next` parameter in `beforeRouteEnter` support to return a Promise" (#1939) at vuejs/vue-router
Opened issue "Cant redirect continuously when the path is dynamic" (#1938) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/wangyi7099/pen/JMdRYq](https://codepen.io/wangyi7099/pen/JMdRYq)

### Steps to reproduce
As I want to set the default render component when the parent component was rendered. so I use redirect  to redirect to the component I want to render for the default. But it seems not to work, when I want to redirect component  continuously when the path is dynamic.And the console shows the warning:" [vue-router] missing param for redirect route with path "/:bigCata/smallCata": Expected "bigCata" to be defined"

### What is expected?
The default components can be rendered.

### What is actually happening?
The redirect doesn't work.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

(vue.esm.js?efeb:4131) ``` the error is happening in the props parameter. Removing the parameter props the component mounts correctly here is the rest of code ```javascript // state.js export default { components: [] } // mutations.js export default { setComponent (state, component) { state.components.push(component) } } // getters.js export default { getComponent (state) { return state.components } } ``` I believe I'm making the correct use of vuex in this case. I'm not seeing the error in my code so I'm reporting ### Environment #### Vue 2.5.11 #### Vuex 3.0.1

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Should vuex mapState print error message" (#1093) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody:
### What problem does this feature solve?
I got the following error: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot convert undefined or null to object
then realized I invoked the  `...mapState(NSP_CONCEPT) `without a second parameter. 
It took some time while I figured out, would have been great, if there is a condition to don't fail or print out a message.


### What does the proposed API look like?
print a message, or put a condition into the function

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
